definition[0]: to praise something or someone in order to persuade people that they are important or worth a lot
example[1]: Nell is being touted as the next big thing in Hollywood.
definition[1]: to try to persuade people to buy goods or services you are offering
example[2]: Minicab drivers are not allowed to tout for business.
definition[2]: to give someone information about a horse in a race
definition[3]: someone who buys tickets for a concert, sports match etc and sells them at a higher price, usually on the street near a sports ground, theatre etc
example[3]: Iâ€™ve been on the phone all morning touting for business.
definition[4]: to praise something or someone in order to persuade people that they are worth accepting, using etc
example[4]: She is being touted as the best candidate for the job.
definition[5]: someone who buys tickets for a concert, sports match etc and sells them for more than the official price
